result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeffrey D Thieme Jr

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on December 9, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed. Comply with all licensing restrictions.

10:32 AM; Case called for Initial appearance. Defendant Jeffrey D Thieme Jr in court.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Nikole Kane.  Court confirms with the defendant that he plans to proceed without an attorney.  Court notes a warrant was stayed until today's date.  Based on the defendant's appearance the court will not issue the capias.  Court provides the defendant with a copy of the complaint.  Court reviews the charges with the defendant. Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Initial appearance on October 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.

9:47 AM Defendant Jeffrey D Thieme Jr not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Molly M Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court notes the defendant has another pending matter set for pre-trial conference on October 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.  Court adjourns for initial appearance and ordered a warrant stayed until next court date.
Initial appearance scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.
